meanings.definition: Morris - a type of traditional English folk dance involving rhythmic stepping and intricate formations.
meanings.sent1: The group of dancers performed the morrises with precision and grace.
meanings.sent2: Every May Day, the village gathers to watch the morrises in the town square.
meanings.sent3: The morrises at the festival had everyone clapping and smiling.
meanings.sent4: Her movements on the dance floor were like a beautiful morrises performance.
meanings.sent5: The music filled the air as the morrises brought joy to all who watched.

meanings.definition: Morris - a surname of English origin.
meanings.sent1: The Morrises have a family reunion every summer at the lake.
meanings.sent2: Mr. Morris greeted his neighbors with a warm smile.
meanings.sent3: The Morrises were known for their delicious apple pie recipe.
meanings.sent4: The legacy of the Morris family was deeply rooted in the town's history.
meanings.sent5: The Morris name was respected throughout the community for generations.

meanings.definition: Morris - a plural form of the name 'Morris'.
meanings.sent1: The invitation was addressed to the Morrises, inviting them to the party.
meanings.sent2: All the Morrises gathered for a group photo at the family reunion.
meanings.sent3: The Morrises decided to paint their house a vibrant shade of blue.
meanings.sent4: In the park, the Morrises enjoyed a picnic under the shady trees.
meanings.sent5: The Morrises' laughter echoed through the halls of their home.
